abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Adjustment Loan
            Project supports the first phase of the government of
            Uruguay's sector reform program aiming at 1) improving
            competition in the banking sector establishing a more level
            playing field between public and private banks; 2)
            strengthening banking regulation, supervision, and
            inspection; 3) restructuring public banks; 4) assisting in
            the privatization of a bank under public management; 5)
            introducing more transparency in the financial sector; and
            6) assisting in the modernization of the financial
            sector's legal framework. The loan will be disbursed in
            one tranche, upon loan effectiveness. The Bank's
            strategy is to support incremental policy improvements in
            the financial sector, while continuing the dialogue and
            technical work needed to ensure consensus on more far
            reaching financial sector reforms in the future. To
            accelerate the pace of policy reform in Uruguay, the
            executive authorities need to be able to present the policy
            options to the various stakeholders, the public, the trade
            unions and the Parliament, in a convincing manner. To
            address this need, the loan also supports the creation of a
            Technical Unit that will conduct legal and technical studies
            in key areas of concern in the financial sector which will
            be the basis of policy reform proposals submitted for
            discussion among the different interested parties, including
            members of Parliament.
